channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2024010663
item.description:
Report X-2024010663

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON THE UNLOAD TRAILER FROM THE PREVIOUS FACILITY. DescribePack: THE CAPS WERE LOOSE AND THE SEALS WERE DEFECTIVE ON THE PLASTIC JUGS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found as damaged during the unload process. DescribePack: Loose caps caused spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put in lined tote & taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024010652
item.description:
Report X-2024010652

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-30
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking during the load process after finding a stain on the side of the box. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was discovered that one of the bottles of Rapicide part A had a loose cap and had leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put in lined hazmat tote and taken to cage.
